results.title: Memorandum
results.creator_credit: John Kemeny, ONF | NFB, Donald Brittain and John Spotton
results.brief_description: The memorandum was Hitler’s and the subject was the final solution to the ‘Jewish problem’. In this outstanding documentary, a Jewish Canadian takes a holiday from his glazier’s shop in Toronto to join an emotional pilgrimage with 30 Jewish Americans to the necropolis of Bergen Belsen. In travelling through the New Germany, this man remembers - scenes still vivid in his mind are recalled in flashback. Includes footage of concentration camp administrators on trial for their role in the Holocaust. (Awards: San Francisco, Venice, Vancouver, Montreal)

results.title: Memo...Melbourne...Australia
results.creator_credit: Bilcock and Copping Film Productions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A brief, non-narrated look at Melbourne, using facts and statistics to give an outline of industry and manufacture, transport, energy resources, people and government. Commissioned by the Victorian Film Corporation on behalf of State Development.

results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Jean Cleinge
results.brief_description: Through Memling’s paintings the civilisation of Bruges at the end of the Middle Ages is evoked-customs, rich costumes, religious beliefs and economics of the day.

results.title: Memento
results.creator_credit: Centre for Mass Communication of Columbia University Press and Stefan Sharff
results.brief_description: A fresh approach in the field of automobile safety, Memento uses picture and sound contrapuntally. Photographed in an automobile “graveyard”, the film presents a picture study of cars irreparably smashed in accidents, while the sound track reconstructs the voices of the participants of three particular accidents.

results.title: Melody in music
results.brief_description: A school instrumental ensemble consisting of violin, tuba, piccolo, flute, chimes, piano, cornet and French horn, learn the importance of melody in music. The film hows how variations in note arrangement, lyrics, different music instruments, note length, and tune all effect the melody. Students are encouraged to make their own melodies by learning how other melodies are developed. The film concludes with a performance by the ensemble of a simplified arrangement of the final movement of the Brahms First Symphony.

results.title: Melodies that linger
results.brief_description: A straightforward presentation of 40s vintage pop songs - “Number 10 Lullaby Lane” featuring singer Marilyn Stuart; “A Lover Is Blue”, Tommy Reynolds and his orchestra with Phyllis Lane the singer; “Penthouse Serenade” with singers Johnny Downs and Gale Storm.

results.title: Melodie En Sous-Sol = the Big Snatch (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
An ex-con sets up one last job and enlists the help of a younger crook to rob the Casino at Cannes. Everything goes according to plan, right up to the last minute until … A very standard caper film which gives one more opportunity to the trio Verneuil-Gabin-Audiard to send up the gangster genre with razor-sharp one-liners. Like his illustrious predecessors Henri Jeanson and Jacques Prevert, Audiard mixed classic French and slang and delighted in derision and ‘bons mots’, though his dialogue was coarser (a sign of the times) and more schocking. (…) Audiard’s witty, hard-hitting dialogue underpins much of the best popular French cinema from the late 1950s to the mid-1980s, notably his collaborations with Jean Gabin, for whom he wrote tailor-made dialogue.” Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. The companion to French cinema. BFI Publishing, 1996.

Credits: Producer, Jacques Juranville ; director, Henri Verneuil ; writers, Albert Simonin, Michel Audiard ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Michel Magne.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Alain Delon, Maurice Biraud, Viviane Romance, Henri Virlojeux, Germaine Montero, Jean Carmet, Dora Doll.

results.title: Melodic percussion
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Muir Mathieson, Anvil Films and Record Group and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
James Blades demonstrates the orchestral instruments of percussion - other than timpani - which are capable of melody as opposed to pure rhythm. the xylophone, vibraphone, marimba, glockenspiel, tubular bells and tuned gongs emerge in detail as vital parts of the modern orchestra and dance band.

results.title: Melina Mercouri's Athens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
The vivacity of Melina Mercouri - singer, actress and parliamentarian, shines through as she reveals Athens as “a city with ancient ruins but with a heart that beats stronger than ever before”.

results.title: Melbourne: the school of the forties 1943-1947
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
The Expressionist Eye (13 min) - A look at a period of Australian art that was influenced by European Expressionism. “Victory Girls” (9 min) - A film about Australian artist, Albert Tucker and his work. “Mining Town” (10 min) - an examination of this Arthur Boyd painting. “Stringybark Creek” (10 min) - examines the art of Sidney Nolan. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
